3.speaker: PANDA MAMA
3.english: What am I going to do?

4.speaker: PANDA MAMA
4.japanese: ｷﾝｸﾞﾍﾟﾝｷﾞﾝさんからのお歳暮の 新巻鮭
4.english: The lightly salted salmon we got as a year-end gift from Mrs. King Penguin

5.speaker: PANDA MAMA
5.japanese: 嬉しいけど うちじゃ 食べないのよね
5.english: was a nice thought, but we don't eat salmon.

6.speaker: PANDA MAMA
6.english: There you are, lazing around since morning.

7.speaker: PANDA MAMA
7.japanese: 掃除の邪魔よ どきなさい
7.english: I can't clean with you there. You need to move.

8.speaker: PANDA
8.japanese: 今 いいとこなんだよ
8.english: But I'm at a good part.

9.speaker: PANDA MAMA
9.japanese: 掃除するなら 家の外でしなよ
9.english: If you're going to clean, do it outside. Don't suck me up!

13.speaker: PANDA
13.japanese: もう お母さん 短気だよね
13.english: Jeez. My mom's so short-tempered, don't you think?

14.speaker: PENGUIN
14.japanese: お母さんが短気なんじゃなくて ｷﾐがひと言多いんじゃないかな
14.english: I don't think it's that your mom is short-tempered. I think you always say one thing too many. So she tried to suck you up with the vacuum again?

15.speaker: PANDA
15.japanese: 掃除機って 壊れやすいんだね

16.speaker: SASAKO
16.japanese: え? 壊れちゃったの

17.speaker: PANDA
17.japanese: うん これで もう吸われないよ
17.english: Yeah! So she can't suck me up anymore!

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: めでたし めでたし

19.speaker: PENGUIN
19.japanese: めでたしじゃないでしょ
19.english: I don't think that's the right phrase in this case. I'll give you one of these, Panda.

20.speaker: PANDA
20.japanese: なに 僕と握手できる券
20.english: What's that? A ticket to be able to shake hands with me?

21.speaker: POLAR BEAR
21.japanese: そう しろくまｶﾌｪで ﾊﾟﾝﾀﾞくんと握手
21.english: Yes! It's a ticket for people to shake your hand at Polar Bear's Café.

23.speaker: SASAKO
23.english: It's a lottery ticket for the drawing.

24.speaker: POLAR BEAR
24.japanese: 豪華景品を用意してあるから
24.english: We have luxurious prizes lined up.

26.speaker: SASAKO
26.japanese: この格好 必要ですか
26.english: Is this outfit necessary? It's all about service, Miss Sasako.

27.speaker: POLAR BEAR
27.japanese: 僕だって 好きで着てるわけじゃないよ
27.english: I mean, I'm not wearing this because I want to.

28.speaker: PENGUIN
28.english: No, I think you actually do want to.

30.speaker: SASAKO
30.japanese: ﾉﾘﾉﾘで 着てるんですよね
30.english: You're super excited to wear that, aren't you?

31.speaker: POLAR BEAR
31.english: You've started butting into conversations, Miss Sasako.

32.speaker: POLAR BEAR
32.japanese: この1年で すっかり成長したね
32.english: You've grown quite a bit this past year. Pardon?

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.english: I don't think that growth is needed in the café.

34.speaker: PANDA
34.japanese: 早く 抽選 始めようよ

37.speaker: PANDA
37.english: Yay! Luxurious prizes! Here you go. Your luxurious prize.

39.speaker: SASAKO
39.japanese: おめでとうございます

41.speaker: POLAR BEAR
41.english: Here you go. Your luxurious prize.

43.speaker: POLAR BEAR
43.japanese: 職人の手により棕櫚の木で作られた高級品だよ
43.english: It's a high-quality item that was hand-crafted by an artisan from a palm tree

45.speaker: POLAR BEAR
45.japanese: じゃあ 始めようか

47.speaker: PENGUIN
47.english: Really? Is that what this is about?

48.speaker: POLAR BEAR
48.japanese: みんなでやれば楽しいよ
48.english: It'll be fun if we all do it.

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.japanese: あのさ 年末だから 振り返っちゃうけど
49.english: You know, it's the end of the year, so I'm looking back... But didn't I help you with weed pulling this past summer?

50.speaker: POLAR BEAR
50.japanese: そんなこともあったかもね

51.speaker: PENGUIN
51.japanese: 僕らのこと お客様だと思ってないでしょ
51.english: You don't see us as loyal customers, do you?

53.speaker: PENGUIN
53.japanese: きれいにまとめれば 何でも許されるわけじゃないよ
53.english: Just because you wrap things up well doesn't mean you're forgiven. Don't suck me up! What are you doing, Panda?!

54.speaker: PENGUIN
54.english: There we go! Don't suck me up! A lottery?

56.speaker: SASAKO
56.japanese: おめでとうございます

58.speaker: LLAMA
58.english: Big winner? Here you go, the silver prize.

59.speaker: LLAMA
59.english: I wonder if it's a catalog for a trip to Hawaii.

62.speaker: POLAR BEAR
62.japanese: 雑草 食べ放題だよ

65.japanese: まずはいらないものをまとめようか
65.english: let's gather the things we don't need first.

67.speaker: PANDA
67.japanese: うわぁ いっぱいあるね

68.speaker: PENGUIN
68.japanese: こんなのどこにしまってたの
68.english: Where did you even have this stuff?

70.speaker: PENGUIN
70.english: It's not a good idea to do that joke!

71.speaker: SASAKO
71.japanese: これはどうしましょう
71.english: What should I do with these?

72.speaker: PANDA
72.japanese: また庭から出てきたの?
72.english: You found some more things in the yard?

74.speaker: PENGUIN
74.japanese: ここの庭 一度しかるべき機関に発掘調査してもらったほうがいいんじゃないかな
74.english: You should probably have some professionals conduct an archaeological dig in that yard sometime.

75.speaker: SASAKO
75.japanese: なんか 逆に散らかっちゃいましたよね
75.english: We seem to be making more of a mess, aren't we? I know!

79.speaker: GRIZZLY
79.japanese: 北半球生態系の最強の生物
79.english: one of the strongest animals in the northern hemisphere's ecosystem,

80.speaker: GRIZZLY
80.japanese: かつ冬ごもり中の俺に大掃除させようってんじゃねえだろうな
80.english: to do big cleaning when I should be hibernating, are you?!

81.speaker: POLAR BEAR
81.japanese: その格好で言っても説得力ないよ
81.english: You're not very convincing when you're dressed like that.

85.speaker: PANDA
85.japanese: 半田さん 掃除が趣味でしょ
85.english: Cleaning is your hobby, right, Mr. Handa?

86.speaker: HANDA
86.japanese: いや 別に 趣味ってわけじゃ…
86.english: Well, I wouldn't call it a hobby...

88.speaker: HANDA
88.japanese: え? あ… いえ 僕 掃除大好きですから
88.english: Oh, it's okay. I love cleaning!

94.speaker: GRIZZLY
94.japanese: 半田 すみっこのﾎｺﾘもとるんだぞ
94.english: Handa, make sure you get the dust in the corners, too.

96.speaker: GRIZZLY
96.japanese: 半田 ｿｹｯﾄは濡らすんじゃねえぞ
96.english: Handa! Don't get the sockets wet!

99.speaker: HANDA
99.japanese: 汚れのひどいところはｾｽｷ炭酸ｿｰﾀﾞを使えば落ちますよ
99.english: if you use baking soda on the spots that don't come off easily, that should take care of it.

101.speaker: PENGUIN
101.japanese: 相変わらず 暴力的で丁寧な仕事ぶりだ
101.english: His work is as violent, yet careful, as ever.

107.speaker: PANDA MAMA
107.japanese: あら お待ちになって
107.english: Oh. Could you wait a moment?

108.speaker: GRIZZLY
108.english: I'm tired. Don't freakin' suck me up!

110.japanese: もう この子ったら
110.english: What am I going to do with you? Mr. Grizzly.

112.speaker: PANDA MAMA
112.japanese: せっかくですから 鮭召し上がっていってください
112.english: Since you're here, please have some salmon. Here you go.

114.speaker: POLAR BEAR
114.japanese: 鮭 ありがとうございます
114.english: Thank you very much for the salmon.

115.speaker: PANDA MAMA
115.japanese: いえいえ お歳暮のおすそ分けですから
115.english: Oh, it's my pleasure. I'm merely sharing our year-end gift.

116.speaker: PANDA MAMA
116.japanese: 冬ごもりしてるんですってね

117.speaker: PANDA MAMA
117.japanese: しっかり 栄養補給しとかないと
117.english: It's important that you get all your nutrients.

120.speaker: PANDA MAMA
120.english: Oh, thank goodness. It's some good, fresh, fatty salmon.

121.speaker: LLAMA
121.japanese: 労働のあとの草はおいしいですね
121.english: Grass after a hard day's work is always good, isn't it?

122.speaker: PENGUIN
122.japanese: ｷﾐ さっきも庭で草食べてたじゃない
122.english: You were just eating grass in the yard!

123.speaker: SASAKO
123.english: Thank you for your hard work.

125.speaker: SASAKO
125.english: It's a potato and onion padellata.

128.speaker: HANDA
128.japanese: おいしいです 笹子さん

129.speaker: SASAKO
129.japanese: よかった｡ 私も好きです
129.english: Thank goodness. I feel the same way you do.

131.speaker: HANDA
131.japanese: えっ? あっ… えっ

133.speaker: PANDA MAMA
133.japanese: いつも 息子がお世話になってます
133.english: Thanks for always looking after my son.

136.speaker: PANDA MAMA
136.japanese: あの掃除機 よく吸いますわね

137.speaker: GRIZZLY
137.japanese: ほんとだぜ 毛が炎上しちまったよ
137.english: No kidding. My fur looked like it was burning!

139.speaker: PANDA MAMA
139.japanese: うちのは壊れちゃって 買い替えようかしら
139.english: Ours broke, so I was thinking of getting a new one.

140.speaker: POLAR BEAR
140.japanese: あれ さしあげますよ

141.speaker: PANDA MAMA
141.japanese: あら やだ そんなつもりじゃ…
141.english: Oh, I didn't mean I wanted it...

142.speaker: SASAKO
142.japanese: いえ ﾊﾟﾝﾀﾞくんが福引きで当てたんです
142.english: Oh, no. Panda won it in the lottery. Oh, really? I'll give it to you, Mom, as a slightly late Christmas present.

144.speaker: GRIZZLY
144.japanese: ﾊﾟﾝﾀﾞ… 意外と親孝行ないい子じゃねえか
144.english: You're not a bad kid, Panda.

147.speaker: PANDA
147.japanese: それに比べて お母さんはね…

148.speaker: PANDA
148.japanese: 僕のｺﾞﾛｺﾞﾛの邪魔になるから
148.english: I wish my mom wouldn't clean

149.japanese: 掃除しないでほしいよね
149.english: since it gets in the way of my lazing around. Don't suck me up!

150.speaker: PENGUIN
150.japanese: ﾊﾟﾝﾀﾞくん ひと言多いんだよね
150.english: You always say one thing too many, Panda.

154.speaker: SASAKO
154.english: Is it a New Year's pine decoration?

156.speaker: POLAR BEAR
156.japanese: ｸﾘｽﾏｽﾂﾘｰを再利用してみたんだ

157.speaker: SASAKO
157.japanese: ﾂﾘｰを片づけるのが面倒だったんですね…
157.english: I'm guessing it was troublesome to put the tree away?

158.speaker: POLAR BEAR
158.english: You could say I'm being green.

159.speaker: PANDA
159.japanese: 常勤さん 何か悩み事
159.english: Something troubling you, Mr. Full-Time Panda? I'm thinking about New Year's vacation.

161.japanese: お休みがたった1週間しかないなんて
161.english: I can't believe we only get one week off.

162.speaker: FT PANDA
162.japanese: ﾊﾟﾝﾀﾞくんは毎週５日も休んでるでしょ
162.english: You always have five days off a week, Panda.

163.speaker: PANDA
163.japanese: 休みじゃなくて 調整日だよ
163.english: Those aren't days off, those are fine-tuning days.

164.speaker: PANDA
164.japanese: 野球のﾋﾟｯﾁｬｰも 毎日投げないでしょ
164.english: Pitchers don't pitch every day, right? What am I going to do?

165.speaker: PANDA
165.japanese: 1か月は休まないと1年の疲れがとれないよ
165.english: If I don't take off at least a month, I can't get rid of all the fatigue from this year.

166.speaker: FT PANDA
166.japanese: 一度 その悩みについて
166.english: I'd like to take that complaint to the front of Shinbashi station and criticize, protest, and object to it.

167.speaker: PANDA
167.japanese: これ 常勤さんの家族
167.english: Oh? Is this your family, Mr. Full-Time Panda?

169.speaker: PANDA
169.japanese: 双子の赤ちゃん かわいいね
169.english: The twin babies are so cute! Thanks.

170.speaker: FT PANDA
170.japanese: でも 正月休みに奥さんの実家に帰ると思うと
170.english: But thinking about going to my in-laws' house during vacation

173.speaker: FT PANDA
173.japanese: 今年の正月に帰ったときなんか
173.english: When we went there last year...

174.speaker: FT PANDA
174.japanese: 実家が雨漏りしてるからって
174.english: I was asked to fix the roof because it was leaking.

175.speaker: PANDA
175.japanese: 常勤さん ﾌﾟﾗﾓ作りとか器用だもんね
175.english: Well, you're good at making models.

176.speaker: FT PANDA
176.japanese: でも あとで義理のお母さんから出来が悪いって苦情がきちゃってさ
176.english: But then my mother-in-law would complain that it wasn't done well enough.

179.speaker: HANDA
179.japanese: ここでそんな話やめてください
179.english: Could you please not talk about that here?

180.speaker: FT PANDA
180.japanese: あ～ 半田さんちょうどいいところに

182.speaker: FT PANDA
182.japanese: 年賀状の宛て名書き 手伝ってよ
182.english: Help me write the mailing addresses on these New Year's cards.

184.speaker: FT PANDA
184.japanese: 字が下手なら ﾎﾟｹｯﾄﾃｨｯｼｭの内職やる
184.english: If your penmanship isn't great, would you prefer to do pocket tissue side-job? Please do your job properly!

185.speaker: MANDRILL
185.english: Well then, have a Happy New Year!

186.speaker: I FORGOT
186.english: Close! Too close! See you next year!

187.speaker: VOICE
187.english: I hope you have a great year!

188.speaker: PENGUIN
188.japanese: ｼﾛｸﾏくん ｶﾌｪﾓｶ おかわりね
188.english: Polar Bear, get me another café mocha.

190.speaker: PANDA
190.japanese: 今年中に 聞いておきたいことがあるんだけど…
190.english: there's something I want to ask you before this year ends.

193.speaker: PENGUIN
193.japanese: それって わざわざ今年中に聞くことかな
193.english: Is that really something you had to ask before the year ends?

194.speaker: PANDA
194.japanese: そのことを考えてたら 夜も寝られないんだもん
194.english: When I think about that, I can't even sleep at night.

195.speaker: PENGUIN
195.japanese: 昼寝をやめればいいんじゃない

198.speaker: PENGUIN
198.japanese: よく知らないよ そんなの
198.english: I don't know that much about it.

199.speaker: SASAKO
199.japanese: えっ 何か知らないで ずっと飲んでたんですか
199.english: What? You drink it all the time, but don't know what it is?

202.speaker: PENGUIN
202.japanese: じゃあ 笹子さんは ﾀｰﾒﾘｯｸとかｺﾘｱﾝﾀﾞｰとかｶﾙﾀﾞﾓﾝとか考えながら
202.english: Then do you think about turmeric, coriander, cardamom while you eat curry?

203.speaker: PENGUIN
203.japanese: 煮干しとか 宗田節とか日高昆布とか考えながら
203.english: Do you think about small dried sardines,

204.english: dried bullet mackerel, and Hidaka kelp while eating ramen?

205.speaker: SASAKO
205.japanese: わかりました… すみません…
205.english: I get it. I'm very sorry.

206.speaker: PANDA
206.japanese: なんか前にもﾍﾟﾝｷﾞﾝさん同じようなこと言ってなかった
206.english: I think you've said something like this before, Mr. Penguin.

208.speaker: POLAR BEAR
208.english: In French, it'd be déjà vu.

209.speaker: LLAMA
209.english: Frankly speaking, it just means that Mr. Penguin hasn't grown at all this year.

210.speaker: PENGUIN
210.japanese: ありていにまとめなくていいから
210.english: You don't have to speak frankly.

213.speaker: PANDA
213.english: That would be body measuring {\i1}(shintai sokutei){\i0}.

214.speaker: LLAMA
214.english: That would be apple tea {\i1}(appuru ti—){\i0}.

215.speaker: LLAMA
215.japanese: それは かりぐらしの…
215.english: That would be The Secret World of Arie—

216.speaker: PENGUIN
216.japanese: あぁっ はい 終了

217.speaker: PENGUIN
217.japanese: ﾀﾞﾒだよ 年末にいろいろ終了しちゃうよ
217.english: Don't. The end of this year would be the end for a lot of things.

218.speaker: PENGUIN
218.english: More importantly, Polar Bear, where's my café mocha? Right. Here you go.

219.japanese: ｴｽﾌﾟﾚｯｿにﾁｮｺﾚｰﾄｼﾛｯﾌﾟとｽﾁｰﾑﾐﾙｸを混ぜた飲み物だよ
219.english: A drink made by mixing espresso, chocolate syrup and steamed milk.

220.speaker: PENGUIN
220.japanese: 親切な説明 ありがとう
220.english: Thank you for your kind explanation.

222.speaker: SASAKO
222.english: Well, it is New Year's Eve.

223.speaker: LLAMA
223.japanese: いいんじゃないですか

224.japanese: たまにはまったりいきましょう
224.english: It's good to be laid-back at times.

226.japanese: みんなで 紅白ﾀﾞｼﾞｬﾚ合戦やろうか
226.english: How about we hold a Red vs. White Pun Telling Contest?

227.speaker: PENGUIN
227.japanese: それ まったりじゃないでしょう

228.speaker: PENGUIN
228.japanese: よし ここは一席 僕の落語を…
228.english: All right! This is a job for my traditional comedic storytelling...

229.speaker: PANDA
229.japanese: それは 来年でいいよ
229.english: That can wait until next year.

231.speaker: POLAR BEAR
231.english: It's almost midnight, so we should probably eat that one thing...

233.speaker: SASAKO
233.english: You mean soba? When you think of year-end,

234.speaker: POLAR BEAR
234.japanese: やっぱり 流しそうめんだよね

235.speaker: PENGUIN
235.japanese: 流しそうめんって 年末にやるもの
235.english: Is flowing noodles something you do at the end of the year?

237.speaker: SASAKO
237.japanese: じゃあ いきますよ

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.japanese: ひんやりして おいしい

241.speaker: POLAR BEAR
241.japanese: 冬空の下で食べる そうめんは格別だね
241.english: Noodles eaten under the winter sky taste especially delicious.

242.speaker: POLAR BEAR
242.english: You should have some, too, Miss Sasako.

243.speaker: SASAKO
243.japanese: ちょっと 寒いので

244.speaker: POLAR BEAR
244.english: Then should we make it hot? It's delicious.

245.speaker: POLAR BEAR
245.japanese: にゅう麺にしてみたよ

248.speaker: PANDA
248.japanese: この孟宗竹もおいしいね
248.english: This moso bamboo is great, too.

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.japanese: それも食べちゃうんだ
249.english: You're gonna eat that, too, huh?

250.speaker: PENGUIN
250.japanese: ふぅ～ おいしかった

251.speaker: SASAKO
251.japanese: 今年も あとわずかですね
251.english: There's not much left of this year.

252.speaker: LLAMA
252.japanese: あっという間の1年でした
252.english: The year went by very fast.

253.speaker: POLAR BEAR
253.japanese: ﾊﾟﾝﾀﾞくんや笹子さんに出会ったのは春だったね
253.english: It was in spring when I met Panda and Miss Sasako.

254.speaker: SASAKO
254.japanese: 春にはお花見しましたよね
254.english: We had a cherry blossom viewing party in spring, too.

255.speaker: PANDA
255.japanese: ﾍﾟﾝｷﾞﾝさん 酔っ払ってたよね

257.speaker: POLAR BEAR
257.english: We went to the beach, too. Miss Penko!

258.speaker: PANDA
258.japanese: ﾍﾟﾝｷﾞﾝさん ｽｲｶに刺さってたよね
258.english: Mr. Penguin got stuck in a watermelon.

259.speaker: LLAMA
259.english: There was a love story, too.

261.speaker: PENGUIN
261.japanese: もうちょっといい思い出を探してくれるかな
261.english: Could you look for some more pleasant memories?

262.speaker: PANDA
262.japanese: ﾍﾟﾝｷﾞﾝさんって 残念な思い出しかないよ
262.english: I only have unfortunate memories of you, Mr. Penguin.

263.speaker: PENGUIN
263.english: That's not true! Right, Miss Sasako?

265.speaker: SASAKO
265.japanese: 夏の雑草とりも暑かったけど楽しかったですし
265.english: It was hot weeding in the summer, but it was a lot of fun.

266.speaker: SASAKO
266.japanese: 雨のなか かき氷を食べたのもいい思い出です
266.english: Eating shaved ice in the rain was a nice memory, too.

267.speaker: POLAR BEAR
267.english: Then there was camping in the mountains,

268.japanese: お祭りにも行ったよね
268.english: and we went to a festival, too.

269.speaker: LLAMA
269.japanese: 怪談大会もやりましたよね
269.english: We had a ghost story telling contest, as well.

270.speaker: PENGUIN
270.japanese: 運動会や草野球も楽しかったね
270.english: The sports day and field baseball were fun, too.

271.speaker: PANDA
271.japanese: そうだね 楽しかったね

273.speaker: PANDA
273.japanese: ﾍﾟﾝｷﾞﾝさん 悔いのない人生でよかったね
273.english: I'm glad you lived a life without regrets, Mr. Penguin.

274.speaker: PENGUIN
274.japanese: 人の人生勝手に終わらせないで
274.english: Please don't end my life, thanks.

275.speaker: PENGUIN
275.japanese: また 来年も楽しいことしようよ
275.english: Let's do lots of fun things next year, too.

284.speaker: PANDA
284.english: What brings you here this late?

285.speaker: KOALA
285.japanese: 家でﾃﾚﾋﾞ見てたんだけど 何となくしろくまｶﾌｪのｺｰﾋｰが飲みたくなっちゃって
285.english: I was watching TV at home, but then I felt like drinking coffee from Polar Bear's Café.

286.speaker: POLAR BEAR
286.japanese: そう じゃあ いれようか
286.english: I see. I'll pour you some, then.

289.speaker: KOALA
289.japanese: ここに来たら 誰かいるかな～って
289.english: I thought I might run into people I know if I came here.

290.speaker: POLAR BEAR
290.japanese: 今いれるから 待ってて
290.english: I'll pour some right now, so have a seat.

295.speaker: SASAKO
295.japanese: こんばんは 半田さん

296.speaker: HANDA
296.japanese: こんばんは こんなにお客さん来てるとは思いませんでした
296.english: Good evening. I didn't think you'd have so many customers this evening.

297.speaker: SASAKO
297.japanese: ですよね 私もびっくりです
297.english: I know. I'm surprised, as well.

298.speaker: GRIZZLY
298.japanese: おう 半田 お前も来たのかよ

300.speaker: HANDA
300.japanese: あれ ｸﾞﾘｽﾞﾘｰさんは冬ごもりじゃないんですか
300.english: Oh? Shouldn't you be hibernating, Mr. Grizzly?

301.speaker: POLAR BEAR
301.japanese: そうだよ 寝てなきゃ ﾀﾞﾒだよ

302.speaker: GRIZZLY
302.japanese: お前が起こしたんだろうが!!
302.english: You woke me up, ya jerk!

303.speaker: SASAKO
303.japanese: 皆さん そろそろ年越しですよ
303.english: Everyone, it's almost midnight. All right! Let's all count down.

307.speaker: PENGUIN
307.japanese: 46)}ていうか ｶｳﾝﾄｱｯﾌﾟしてるでしょ それ
307.english: Or rather, you're counting up! Five... Six... Seven...

309.speaker: BOTH
309.english: Good... evening... H-Hey, you know, you two...

312.speaker: BOTH
312.english: be... another... Please wait! great... year... Ack, stop!

315.speaker: PANDA
315.japanese: 今年を振り返って 一番思い出したくないことをザザーて話してみてよ
315.english: Looking back on this year, tell us about the thing you least want to remember.

317.speaker: PANDA
317.japanese: それをbgmに寝ようと思ったのに
317.english: What? But I thought I'd use that as my background music as I slept.

319.speaker: SASAKO
319.japanese: わたしなどよかったら 話しますよ
319.english: I don't mind saying mine if that'll suffice.

320.speaker: PENGUIN
320.japanese: いいんじゃないかな 話さなくて
320.english: I think it'll be okay if you don't. Let's end this, Polar Bear.

321.speaker: POLAR BEAR
321.japanese: 来年のしろくまカフェは一枚の絵だけで頑張ります
321.english: In next year's Polar Bear's Café, we'll do our best with just one picture.
